page.title: 01Stanwell
page.content:
Stanwell can basically be divided into two main areas,{Old}Stanwell,or, {Stanwell Village}, and{New}Stanwell.
{Stanwell Village}started out as a typical 'old England' village. It lies on an old Roman road which goes to London. The probable cause for the start of the village was the road, and, a nearby water source called { {St Annes Well}.It is thought that the name 'Stanwell' comes form the name of this well, but nobody is certain.
As in all 'old England' villages, the church was the centre for all social life, Stanwell is no exception. Adjacent to the road, set a little way back lies the church.
The church was built over many centuries with remnants of Norman
